item.title: How AI Vibe Coding Is Destroying Junior Developers' Careers
item.description: New research shows developers think AI makes them 20% faster but are actually 19% slower. Vibe coding is creating unemployable pseudo-developers who can't debug or maintain code.

item.title: Cloudflare 1.1.1.1 Incident on July 14, 2025
item.description:
On July 14th, 2025, Cloudflare made a change to our service topologies that caused an outage for 1.1.1.1 on the edge, resulting in downtime for 62 minutes for customers using the 1.1.1.1 public DNS Resolver as well as intermittent degradation of service for Gateway DNS.
Weâ€™re deeply sorry for this outage.
This outage was the result of an internal configuration error and not the result of an attack or a BGP hijack. In this blog post, weâ€™re going to talk about what the failure was, why it occurred, and what weâ€™re doing to make sure this doesnâ€™t happen again.

item.title: Death by a thousand slops
item.description: I have previously blogged about the relatively new trend of AI slop in vulnerability reports submitted to curl and how it hurts and exhausts us. This trend does not seem to slow down. On the contrary, it seems that we have recently not only received more AI slop but also more human slop. item.title: To be a better programmer, write little proofs in your head
item.description:
This is a brief write-up of a trick I learned that helps me write code faster and more accurately. I say "trick", but it's really something I started to do without noticing as I moved further into my career.

item.title: NIST Ion Clock Sets New Record for Most Accurate Clock in the World
item.description: This new result contributes to the international effort to define the second with a much greater level of accuracy than before, enabling new scientific and technological advances
